1.title: Episode #2.1

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: We were at the Céad festival at the Camden Irish centre. As well as Liam Ó Maonlaí of The Hothouse Flowers, on the bill was Rónán Ó Snodaigh from Kila, spoken word artist Stiofán Séamus MacGabhann and Glen Austin's New Airs.

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot:

3.title: Episode #2.3

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: We chatted with Hughie O'Donoghue about his Seven Halts on the Somme exhibition, newly appointed Minister of State for Diaspora Joe McHugh and also headed to Woolwich Arsenal for a charity concert organised by singer songwriter Don Mescall.

6.title: Episode #2.6

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: In a music filled show we chatted with Offaly accordion legend and Bardic lifetime achievement award recipient, John Bowe, about his life in music. Amongst his many friends that contributed were Foster and Allen and The Thatch Céilí Band.

7.title: Episode #2.7

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

7.plot:
Know what this is about?

8.title: Episode #2.8

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

8.plot: We were at Parliament for the retirement of Noreen Delaney, we spoke to the people Campbell Gordon Way about their prize winning flowers and headed to the Hooley in Islington to chat to Karen Ryan, about the 18th Return to Camden Festival.

9.title: Episode #2.9

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

9.plot: We joined the Irish community for a fundraiser in aid of The RNOH, we joined the tennis2bee charity for the annual Craic Cup and we were at Cecil Sharp House, Camden, for a memorial concert in honour of accordion legend Raymond Roland.

1.title: Episode #1.1

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

32.title: Episode #1.32

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

32.plot: We were at Bolivar Hall for The Irish Opera Stars of the Future concert, we spoke to singer-songwriter Stephen Hodd about his music career and we attended a reception for the recipients of the annual Ireland Fund of Great Britain Award.

33.title: Episode #1.33

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

33.plot: We went along to Monaghan's Tavern to catch up with 'Erris Connection', a Band from Belmullet in County Mayo. We also attended a very successful event in The Houses of Parliament, pour on by The London Irish Construction Network..

34.title: Episode #1.34

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

34.plot: On this week's 'Crossrail' Special of Out and About in the UK, we'll be taking a look at the biggest civil infrastructure project in Europe right now, and later in the show, we'll be in Woolwich to chat to some of the Irish workers on site.

35.title: Episode #1.35

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

35.plot: London has turned green to celebrate St. Patrick's Day. On this week's Out and About in the UK, we'll be soaking up the fantastic atmosphere and chatting to some of the people involved in the day's events.

36.title: Episode #1.36

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

36.plot: It's St. Patrick's Day again and towns and cities around the world are painted green in celebration. The Out and About in the UK team are in the heart of London to enjoy the parade, the music and festivities.

37.title: Episode #1.37

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

37.plot: We were at The Madejski Stadium for the London Irish Rugby St. Patrick's Day Celebrations, we paid a visit to cab driver turned author John Healy about his new book and we chatted with Lara Morgan, about the key to her business success.

38.title: Episode #1.38

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

38.plot: We spoke to author Tom O'Mara,about his humorous novel called, 'HRH Prince Philip: Escape from the Palace.' We also chatted with The BibleCode Sundays, and attended a business learning event held by the British and Irish Trading Alliance.

39.title: Episode #1.39

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

39.plot: We met with Tir Eolas, a five-piece band, formed by percussionist Ruairí Glasheen, we went to the Tara Camogie London 7's Competition in Greenford and met with Declan Duggan, author of the book 'In the Name of the Sun.'

40.title: Episode #1.40

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

40.plot: The Luton Irish Forum was set up in 1997 and are now over 900 members strong and we popped in for a chat and to find out more about what they do. We also attended the groundbreaking ceremony of the new Headquarters of London GAA in Ruislip.

41.title: Episode #1.41

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

41.plot: We headed off to Holborn, where the Ireland Fund of Great Britain held a celebration night of Irish Culture. We also spoke to the former employees of Vauxhall in Luton and we spoke to BITA who recently launched their new website.

42.title: Episode #1.42

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

42.plot: We caught up with Dr Reg Hall who told us all about the History of Traditional Irish Music in London, Michael Kingston, who gave an informative talk on the sinking of the Lusitania, and this year's London Rose of Tralee selection.

43.title: Episode #1.43

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

43.plot: We went to the Clayton Crown Hotel in Cricklewood for the launch of the fifth album from the ever-popular London Lasses and Chris O'Malley. We were also at the Darkness Into Light Charity Walk/Run in aid of Pieta House.

44.title: Episode #1.44

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

44.plot: On this week's show, we caught up with Greyhound Trainer, Seamus Gaughan; and went along to The Art of a Nation Exhibition in The Mall Galleries.

45.title: Episode #1.45

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

45.plot: We have all the highlights from this year's London Marathon; and we're also at the Emerald Grounds in Ruislip this for the Connacht Senior Football Championship Quarter-Final between London and Roscommon.

46.title: Episode #1.46

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

46.plot: This week we went to the annual GAA Fundraiser for Training and Development; Diana went along to the launch of the LA College of Creative Arts in London; and we caught up with popular Irish band The Monday Club at the Kilburn Festival.

47.title: Episode #1.47

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

47.plot: We were at the London GAA, which was recently renamed the Irish TV grounds, we attended this year's Pretty Muddy Fun Run in aid of Cancer Research UK, and we also attended a party in honour of World Irish Dancing champion Joe McGeown.

48.title: Episode #1.48

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

48.plot: We met artist Comhghall Casey, at his recent exhibition, we also caught up with David Brooks, of The David Motel band, and we are at The Hooley in Bloomsbury where some of London's finest traditional Irish musicians performed.

49.title: Episode #1.49

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

49.plot: We're at The Claddagh Ring in Hendon for the launch of a new independent film called, "Jack Mulligan," and Maggie heads over to the Grange St. Paul's Hotel in Central London for the Friends of Kerry GAA fundraiser.

50.title: Episode #1.50

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

50.plot: We head to Downhills Park for the opening of the new sporting facilities of Eire Og GAA Club, Holloway Gaels and Finsbury Park Rugby Club. We also caught up with Crossharbour, a dynamic part of the traditional Irish music scene in London.

51.title: Episode #1.51

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

51.plot: We went along to Hennessy's Pub for an event to raise money for Kilkenny GAA; we met Galway Band We Banjo 3 at this year's City of London Festival; and we paid a visit to Ealing Golf Club for this year's London Irish Rugby Golf Day.

52.title: Episode #1.52

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

52.plot: We were at the Churchill Arms in Kensington to join landlord, Gerry O'Brien, in celebrating 30 years in charge of this award-winning pub. We also joined in the fun at the London Irish Centre for this year's Tedfest.

53.title: Episode #1.53

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

53.plot: We were at the Tricycle Theatre for the screening of two award-winning Irish Films and we were at The Claddagh Ring in Hendon, to wish this year's London Rose all the best on the road to Tralee.

54.title: Episode #1.54

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

54.plot: We went to the London Irish Centre for the launch of the London issue of the Stinging Fly Magazine. We also met traditional Irish music legend, Matt Cunningham, during his UK Tour.

55.title: Episode #1.55

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

55.plot: We went along to the Mazenod Hall in Kilburn to meet the Irish Elderly Advice Network who recently held a night of Irish Culture. We also met the crew members of London's Air Ambulance.

56.title: Episode #1.56

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

56.plot: This week, we meet up with Tony Christie who has collaborated with Irish band Ranagri to record an album of old Irish songs, and we also go along to this year's Crawley Irish Festival.

57.title: Episode #1.57

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

57.plot: We meet up with Tony Woods MD of Midland Steel Reinforcement Supplies who operate in the UK and Ireland. We also went along to this years Crawley Irish Festival and Met Ronan McManus to talk about his new band 'Brand New Zeros.'

58.title: Episode #1.58

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

58.plot: This week went along to this year's London Irish Vintage Rally held in Greenford.

59.title: Episode #1.59

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

59.plot: We spoke to the Ireland Fund of Great Britain who took part in The Ireland run the World 5K Global challenge, visited this years Cam Expo in Olympia and chatted with Michael Casey who was in town to Perform in the Queens Head in Stratford.

60.title: Episode #1.60

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

60.plot: We met members of the Irish Community in Luton who promote the GAA in the Town. We went along to the House of Lords for the Launch of Console UK and we were at the Clayton Crown Hotel in Cricklewood for the Kerry Person of the Year Award.

61.title: Episode #1.61

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

61.plot: We were at The Irish TV Grounds for this years London senior hurling final, we went along to a fund raiser for Cancer treatment services in Romford and we caught up with Paul Guckian to speak to him about his company Delaney Biometrics.

62.title: Episode #1.62

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

62.plot: This week we were at the Leydon Gallery as part of the Yeats 2015 celebrations, we attended a charity Rugby match hosted by Finsbury Park rugby club and we were in Conway's 3 for the annual Ballycroy reunion.

63.title: Episode #1.63

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

63.plot: We join members of BITA who recently held a very successful Charity Golf Day. We meet some Irish organisations who benefit from The Emigrant Support Programme. And we attended this year's Mayo Association Dinner Dance in Luton.

64.title: Episode #1.64

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

64.plot: We go along to the Irish Embassy for the launch of the London Irish Business Alliance. We also meet members of the Sligo Business Network and attended the Corporate Ireland Gala Ball at the Dorchester Hotel.

65.title: Episode #1.65

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

65.plot: On the show we were at the Irish Embassy in London for the launch of a program of Events to commemorate the centenary of the 1916 rising and we joined members of the Irish Pensioners forum of east London for their annual get together.

66.title: Episode #1.66

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

66.plot: We went to the launch of a charity single from The Ginger Meledoen Experience . We were at the Irish TV grounds in Ruislip for the book launch of Kerry Legend Thomas O Shea and we were at O'Gradys Bar in Seven Kings.

67.title: Episode #1.67

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

67.plot: We spoke to Conor Gallagher about his amazing landscapes, visited the Houses of Parliament where the TLICN network discussed 'BERXIT' and chatted with Tara McDonald who chats about her family, her musical career and her brand new single.

68.title: Episode #1.68

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

68.plot: We headed to Glasgow for the 17th Jimmy McHugh weekend festival. This annual event attracts world class musicians from around the globe and has become the winter event not to be missed.

69.title: Episode #1.69

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

69.plot: We met Phyllis Morgan of The Irish Women's Survivors Support Network, Paralympics Ireland who were in London to launch their campaign in the lead up to the Summer games In Rio and we have more from the Jimmy McHugh Festival in Glasgow.

70.title: Episode #1.70

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

70.plot: On this weeks show we met singer-songwriter Don Mescal, went along to the London launch of a new product from Revive active and we were in O'Grady's Bar to meet the Cream of the Horse Racing fraternity.

71.title: Episode #1.71

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

71.plot: On this weeks show we were in the Centre of London for this years St Patricks Day Parade.

72.title: Episode #1.72

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

72.plot: On this weeks show we were in Central London for this years St Patrick's Day Parade. We Joined the Brent Irish Advisory Service and Safestart for their St Patrick's day celebrations and attended a St Patrick's Day event organised by TFL.

73.title: Episode #1.73

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

73.plot: On this weeks show we attended a screening of the highly acclaimed documentary "1916". We met up with businessman Joe Killoughery to find out more about his company and at we were at The Stationers Hall for the Annual ICAP Dinner.

74.title: Episode #1.74

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

74.plot: In an Easter Rising themed episode of the show we attended The Poets Rebellion event put on by the Luton Irish Forum and hosted by Cerys Matthews MBE, We also spoke to Sharon Sexton about her one woman play 'A Fit Wife for a Revolutionary'.

75.title: Episode #1.75

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

75.plot: We spoke to author Dennis Carey, artist Bernard Canavan and music historian Reg Hall at the launch concert of his new CD collection charting the history of Traditional Irish music in London.

76.title: Episode #1.76

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

76.plot: We met with the London Uileann Pipers Club, chatted to artist Declan Kerr about his 1916 themed exhibition and spoke to Dr Reg Hall about the release of his doctoral thesis which charts the history of Traditional Irish music in London.

77.title: Episode #1.77

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

77.plot: We joined the performers of an Easter Rising Centenary Concert at Wigmore Hall, chatted to Uileann pipe maker Hubert Kwisthout about his craft and attended an IIBN and British and Irish chamber of Commerce conference about Brexit.

78.title: Episode #1.78

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

78.plot: We were at the launch of Gael Londain, a new youth GAA club in Hazelwood to talk about the plans they have for the club and joined this years finalists at the Clayton Crown Hotel to see who would be crowned the 2016 London Rose of Tralee.

79.title: Episode #1.79

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

79.plot: We attended a 1916 Easter Rising lecture at St Pauls Centre in Hammersmith, the Official opening of the new O'Donovan waste recycling facilities, the Annual Mayo Day celebrations in Luton and met the talented Dublin Hip-Hop Duo Abandoman.

80.title: Episode #1.80

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

80.plot: This week we spoke to Author and Playwright Peter Sinclair about his recent play Troubled Times, we were at Ruislip for the big game between London and Mayo and we spoke to Former Republic of Ireland and Celtic Goal Keeper Packie Bonner.

81.title: Episode #1.81

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

81.plot: We were at The Annual Donegal Golf Society charity Golf Day, the BAFTA premiere of the Jack Mulligan Movie and spent an evening with the former President of Ireland Mary McAleese as she set out a case against Britain's exit from the EU.

82.title: Episode #1.82

episode of.title: Out & About in the UK (TV Series 2014– )

82.plot: A great blast of music from the Hop Pole Session Wandsworth, the GAA All Britain Competition launch at the Irish Embassy and a very interesting chat with Marcus Howard about his recent Michael Collins lecture.
